articles.title: Indexing, Hashing & Query Optimization in DBMS
articles.description: Databases handle massive data efficiently using indexes and hashing. Instead of scanning entire tables, indexes act like the index of a book, making lookups faster. In this blog, we‚Äôll build a Students table, create B-Tree, B+Tree, and Hash indexes, and run queries to see their effect. üìñ Key Defini
articles.content: Databases handle massive data efficiently using indexes and hashing. Instead of scanning entire tables, indexes act like the index of a book, making lookups faster. In this blog, we‚Äôll build a Students table, create B-Tree, B+Tree, and Hash indexes, and run queries to see their effect. üìñ Key Definitions üîπ Indexing Indexing is a technique to speed up data retrieval from a database. Instead of scanning the whole table, the database uses an index (like a book index) to locate the rows quickly. B-
articles.author: Reshma Devi

articles.title: Stop Fighting Sanity's Portable Text - Here's How to Use Markdown Instead
articles.description: Let me tell you about the worst hour of my Tuesday. I wrote a 2,000-word blog post in Notion. Beautiful formatting, perfect headings, code blocks, the works. Then I tried to publish it to my Sanity CMS. One hour later , I was manually converting this: ## How to Use the API Simply call the `fetchData
articles.content: Let me tell you about the worst hour of my Tuesday. I wrote a 2,000-word blog post in Notion. Beautiful formatting, perfect headings, code blocks, the works. Then I tried to publish it to my Sanity CMS. One hour later , I was manually converting this: ## How to Use the API Simply call the `fetchData()` function: \`\`\` javascript const data = await fetchData() \`\`\` Into this monstrosity: { _type : ' block ' , style : ' h2 ' , children : [{ _type : ' span ' , text : ' How to Use the API ' }] },
articles.author: Setasena Randata

articles.title: The Great Divide
articles.description: The smartphone in your pocket processes your voice commands without sending them to distant servers. Meanwhile, the same device relies on vast cloud networks to recommend your next video or detect fraud in your bank account. This duality represents one of technology's most consequential debates: whe
articles.content: The smartphone in your pocket processes your voice commands without sending them to distant servers. Meanwhile, the same device relies on vast cloud networks to recommend your next video or detect fraud in your bank account. This duality represents one of technology's most consequential debates: where should artificial intelligence actually live? As AI systems become increasingly sophisticated and ubiquitous, the choice between on-device processing and cloud-based computation has evolved from a
articles.author: Tim Green

articles.title: ICE wants to build a 24/7 social media surveillance team
articles.description: ICE plans to hire contractors to scan platforms to target people for deportation.
articles.content: United States immigration authorities are moving to dramatically expand their social media surveillance , with plans to hire nearly 30 contractors to sift through posts, photos, and messages‚Äîraw material to be transformed into intelligence for deportation raids and arrests. Federal contracting records reviewed by WIRED show that the agency is seeking private vendors to run a multiyear surveillance program out of two of its little-known targeting centers. articles.content: Redemption Road's absolutely bonkers-looking medieval shooter, Kingmakers , was slated to launch in Early Access on October 8, but now its release has been pushed back with no new date in sight. articles.content: A portable storage device can make a world of difference to intensive processing tasks, from running massive video games ‚Äî which feels like all of them these days ‚Äî to core operating system functions. articles.content: Why just post a photo when you can encourage all your friends and followers to engage with it? Have you tried simply uploading a photo to Instagram lately? It's a minefield. articles.description: A close examination of this year's military contracts reveals some interesting things.
articles.content: Around this time each year, the US Space Force convenes a Mission Assignment Board to dole out contracts to launch the nation's most critical national security satellites. The military announced this year's launch orders Friday, and SpaceX was the big winner. Space Systems Command, the unit responsible for awarding military launch contracts, selected SpaceX to launch five of the seven missions up for assignment this year. United Launch Alliance (ULA), a 50-50 joint venture between Boeing and Loc
articles.author: Stephen Clark

articles.title: How different mushrooms learned the same psychedelic¬†trick
articles.description: Scientists may have additional tools to produce psilocybin to use for medical purposes.
articles.content: Magic mushrooms have been used in traditional ceremonies and for recreational purposes for thousands of years. However, a new study has found that mushrooms evolved the ability to make the same psychoactive substance twice. The discovery has important implications for both our understanding of these mushrooms‚Äô role in nature and their medical potential. Magic mushrooms produce psilocybin, which your body converts into its active form, psilocin, when you ingest it. Psilocybin rose in popularity i
articles.author: Fabrizio Alberti, The Conversation

articles.content: According to new polling data , nearly 80 percent of Americans support extending Affordable Care Act (ACA) enhanced premium tax credits, which are set to expire at the end of this year‚Äîand are at the center of a funding dispute that led to a shutdown of the federal government this week. The poll, conducted by KFF and released Friday, found that 78 percent of Americans want the tax credits extended, including 92 percent of Democrats, 59 percent of Republicans‚Äîand even a majority (57 percent) of R
